an5.147:1: "Bhikkhus, there are these five gifts of a bad person. What five? He gives casually; he gives without reverence; he does not give with his own hand; he gives what would be discarded; he gives without a view about the returns of giving.[n.46]Anāgamanadiṭṭhiko deti.Mp:"One gives without having brought forth the view of arrival thus: ‘The fruit of what has been done will arrive.’" Presumably the view of kamma and its result is intended.These are the five gifts of a bad person.
an5.147:2: "Bhikkhus, there are these five gifts of a good person. What five? He gives respectfully; he gives with reverence; he gives with his own hand; he gives what would not be discarded; he gives with a view about the returns of giving.[n.1147]Āgamanadiṭṭhiko.Mp:"He gives with faith in kamma and its result."These are the five gifts of a good person."
